Title: Sapiens
Author: Yuval Noah Harari
Description: A brief history of humankind, exploring how Homo sapiens evolved.

Author: George Orwell
Description: A dystopian novel about a totalitarian regime under Big Brother.

Title: The Catcher in the Rye
Author: J.D. Salinger
Description: A coming-of-age novel following Holden Caulfield's experiences in New York.

Title: To Kill a Mockingbird
Author: Harper Lee
Description: A novel about racial injustice in the Deep South.

Title: Brave New World
Author: Aldous Huxley
Description: A futuristic novel about a genetically engineered society.

Title: The Hobbit
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Description: The adventures of Bilbo Baggins in Middle-earth.

Title: Fahrenheit 451
Author: Ray Bradbury
Description: A novel about a society where books are banned and burned.

Title: The Great Gatsby
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Description: A story about wealth and the American Dream in the 1920s.

Title: The Alchemist
Author: Paulo Coelho
Description: A journey of self-discovery and destiny.

Title: Crime and Punishment
Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
Description: A psychological drama exploring guilt and redemption.

Title: Moby-Dick
Author: Herman Melville
Description: The quest of Captain Ahab for revenge against the white whale.

Title: Pride and Prejudice
Author: Jane Austen
Description: A romantic novel about manners, marriage, and social class.

Title: Dracula
Author: Bram Stoker
Description: The classic tale of Count Dracula and his attempt to move to England.

Title: The Lord of the Rings
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Description: An epic high-fantasy novel following the quest to destroy the One Ring.

Title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
Author: Douglas Adams
Description: A humorous sci-fi novel about space travel and absurdity.
